scenario:
Wall Street's fourth-quarter earnings season begins next week with notable names like JPMorgan Chase, Wells Fargo, Citigroup, BlackRock, Bank of America, Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, UnitedHealth, and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing reporting their financial results. The following week sees high-profile names like Netflix, American Express, Johnson & Johnson, Procter & Gamble, GE Aerospace, American Airlines, United Airlines, and Verizon report earnings. Mega-cap tech companies, including Microsoft, Alphabet, Tesla, Meta Platforms, Amazon, and Apple, are scheduled to release their quarterly updates in the final week of January.

Analysts expect annualized profit growth of +11.9% and an increase of +4.6% in revenue growth. The Financial sector is expected to report the largest annualized earnings growth rate of all eleven sectors, at +39.5%, while the Information Technology sector is forecast to report the second-highest annualized earnings growth rate, at +20.7%. The Energy sector is expected to report the worst drop of any sector, with earnings tumbling -24.6% compared to last year.

American Express is one of the notable names in the Financial sector, which is forecast to report the largest annualized earnings growth rate. The company is expected to deliver growth of more than 25% in both earnings per share and revenue, according to the InvestingPro Stock Screener. Other notable tech-related names that made the cut include Nvidia, Coinbase, Super Micro Computer, Reddit, Robinhood, and Palantir.
